meanings.definition: Sharp or penetrating in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: Her keenest sense was her ability to detect even the slightest change in the air.
meanings.sent2: The knife had the keenest blade, perfect for slicing through tough meat.
meanings.sent3: The detective's keenest observation led to solving the mystery in record time.
meanings.sent4: His keenest insight into human nature made him a sought-after counselor.
meanings.sent5: The keenest pain she felt was the loss of her beloved pet.

meanings.definition: Having a sharp edge or point.
meanings.sent1: The keenest thorn on the rose pricked his finger.
meanings.sent2: The sword had the keenest tip, capable of piercing armor.
meanings.sent3: The keenest pencil in the box was perfect for detailed drawings.
meanings.sent4: The keenest needle in her sewing kit made quick work of mending.
meanings.sent5: The keenest rock on the trail cut his shoe sole.
